intro: Hieracium kralikii, commonly known as the Kralik's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium kralikii is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions.
